abstract: New York City budget includes $2.9 million designated for de Blasio administration's plan to deal with rats; effort will focus on eliminating so-called rat reservoirs, areas where concentrations of rodents are inordinately high; success of plan will be difficult to gauge, given that experts are unsure of actual size of city's rat population.
lead_paragraph: The city budget, expected to be finalized this month, includes $2.9 million in rat money, aimed at attacking large concentrations of the creatures called rat reservoirs.

headline.main: New York City Escalates the War on Rats Once Again
headline.print_headline: New York Escalates Its War Against a Perennial Foe: Rats

snippet: The city budget, expected to be finalized this month, includes $2.9 million in rat money, aimed at attacking large concentrations of the creatures called rat reservoirs.
